name: My name is Dmitry
role: I am a Front-end React Developer
InfoAboutMe1: As a developer I am focusing
InfoAboutMe2: on clean, readable and maintainable code.
InfoAboutMe3: I am eager to work on new projects, because I learn something new every time. I am excited for the next challenge!
InfoAboutMe4: In my previous life I worked as a technical translator for Exxon in Houston, on Sakhalin projects. My responsibilities included interpreting meetings and translating technical documentation.
InfoAboutMe5: During that career I developed such valuable skills as teamwork, respect for corporate ethics, ability to work with large amount of information, attention to details, which help me in my new career path.
InfoAboutMe6: Now I am a front-end React developer. In the last few years I have been working hard to acquire knowledge and practice in programming and website development
mySkills2: React, Redux, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS (Redux-Thunk, RTK, RTK-Query, and Next.js)

Personal: When I am not in front of a computer, I am most likely playing guitar, biking, roller skating, playing soccer or mounting skiing. If I have to describe myself in one word the OPTIMIST would be the right one.

todolistDescription:
Features: login functionality, form validation for login and task creation, creation/removal of to-do lists, adding/removing tasks, displaying task status/filtering by status: all, in progress, completed,
error handling.
Please note that when opening the application and testing its functionality, you may see disorganized to-do lists as the server has unrestricted access and other users can add and remove todo lists.

socialNetworkDescription: This is a social networking project implemented using class components. The application allows users to perform various actions, such as viewing registered members, adding or removing friends, updating their status, and adding/removing posts.

flashCardsDescription: Features: registration, login, password recovery, "remember me" user session persistence, search for decks with cards, sorting decks by parameters: "my" / "others", number of cards, sorting tables by different parameters, creating/deleting decks/cards using modals, switching to study mode. The project is publicly accessible, so there is no content control for the cards. More detailed information about the application is provided in the Readme when accessing the code.
